description: A 4-5 hour London adventure race starting at Hyde Hotel, featuring iconic landmarks, hidden details, and classic British experiences.

clues.title: The Native American at the Foot of a Queen
content: Leave Hyde Hotel and make your way to a famous statue of an English monarch near an even more famous church.
Your mission: Find a statue of a native american woman who sits at the foot of the last monach of the House of Stuart.
Photo Proof: Submit a team photo with the native american woman clearly visible in the background.

clues.title: Nibble on a slice of London's past
content: Travel from St. Paul‚Äôs Cathedral to london's oldest patisserie.
When you find the shop, order a treat and or a coffee and post a picture. Hint: They are famous for  Scones with Clotted Cream and Jam
Photo Proof: Submit a team photo with your treats.

clues.title: Exterminate! Exterminate!
content: Make your way to Forbidden Planet Megastore.
Inside, search for the metal monsters that have been trying to exterminate The Doctor since 1963. These monsters could be toys, in a comic, a book, or somewhere else in the store.
Photo Proof: Take a picture showing at least one of the monsters and one member of your team.

clues.title: British Museum ‚Äì Back Entrance (Montague Place)
content: The British Museum began with a collection of curiosities and has grown into a treasure house of the world's wonders.
Enter through the less-traveled doorway where treasures of millennia await. Make your way to the group entrance of The British Museum (Montague Place) for your pre-booked group entry by 11:10.
Teams will be given access to the next clue in 1 minute intervals in the order they check in with Shannon at the museum.

detourOptionA.title: üëë Kings
detourOptionA.description: Find and photograph these 5 kings: 1) Ramesses II (Room 4), 2) Ashurbanipal (Room 10a), 3) Hadrian (Room 70), 4) Darius I (Room 52), 5) Hoa Hakananai'a (Room 24).

detourOptionB.title: üôè Gods
detourOptionB.description: Find and photograph these 5 gods: 1) Amun-Ra (Room 4), 2) Isis protecting Osiris (Room 62), 3) Bastet (Room 63), 4) Athena (Room 18), 5) Seated Buddha (Room 22).

clues.title: Something Completely Different
content: Make your way to Neal's Yard in Covent Garden, a hidden courtyard known for its colorful buildings and alternative shops.

Your mission: Find the Monty Python plaque commemorating the creative heart of the Python empire. In 1976, Michael Palin and Terry Gilliam purchased offices in this colorful courtyard to serve as studios and editing suites for Python films and other projects.

This became the creative headquarters where the Python team worked on post-production for their films, developed new projects, and continued their collaborative work. The space represented their transition from television sketch comedy to major film productions.
Photo Proof: Take a team photo with the Monty Python plaque clearly visible in the background.

clues.title: Market Feast
content: Make your way to Seven Dials Market, a vibrant food hall in the heart of Covent Garden.
Your first priority: Find Shannon and check in to lock in your arrival order for the next stage of the race.
Once you've checked in, explore this lovely market and find something tasty for lunch. Seven Dials Market brings together some of London's best street food vendors under one roof.
Photo Proof: Take a team photo with Shannon and your chosen meal, showing the Seven Dials Market signage in the background.

detourOptionA.title: üé® Street Art
detourOptionA.description: Make your way to London's Graffiti Tunnel, a long tunnel where graffiti is legal. Each team member must create their own version of the Obot robot icon and logo. Be creative with your designs! Once all team members have finished their robot artwork, take a photo of the entire team with all your robot creations visible.

detourOptionB.title: üñºÔ∏è High Art
detourOptionB.description: Make your way to the Tate Modern and find the painting 'A Bigger Splash' by David Hockney. Using the sketchbook provided, recreate this masterpiece as accurately as possible. Pay attention to the pool, the splash, the house, and the color composition. Once finished, take a photo of the team member holding their sketch in front of the original painting.
